intro: Actinospora, commonly known as the star-shaped fungus, is a genus of fungi belonging to the family Cryphonectriaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, with spores arranged in a star-like pattern, giving it its common name. These fungi are typically found in decaying wood, where they play a role in the decomposition process. Actinospora species are often associated with coniferous trees, contributing to the breakdown of lignin and other complex organic materials. Their ecological significance lies in their ability to recycle nutrients in forest ecosystems.
